What is the difference between the World Wide Web (WWW) and the internet?

options.a: The WWW is a part of the internet

questions.question: What is a web browser and what is its function?

options.c: A program to access and navigate the World Wide Web

questions.question: What is a search engine and how does it work?

options.b: A program that helps users find information on the internet

questions.question: What is the difference between a search term and a keyword?

options.c: A keyword is a single word or short phrase
options.d: A search term can be a longer phrase or question

questions.question: What does HTML stand for?
What is CSS used for in web development?

options.a: Defining the structure of a webpage

questions.question: What does HTTP stand for?
What is the purpose of a firewall in network security?

options.a: To prevent unauthorized access to or from a private network

questions.question: What is the role of a DNS server?

options.b: To translate domain names into IP addresses

questions.question: What is the purpose of a cookie in web browsing?

options.a: To store website data on the client-side
options.b: To track user behavior across multiple websites
options.d: To provide a secure connection to websites

questions.question: What is the significance of the term 'open source' in software development?

options.b: Software with publicly accessible source code
options.c: Software developed without a clear purpose
options.d: Software designed for commercial use only

questions.question: What is the difference between HTTP and HTTPS?

options.a: HTTP is a secure protocol, whereas HTTPS is not
options.b: HTTPS is a secure protocol, whereas HTTP is not
options.c: There is no difference between HTTP and HTTPS
options.d: HTTP and HTTPS are both secure protocols

questions.question: What is the purpose of a compiler in programming?

options.a: To convert source code into machine code
options.b: To execute source code line by line
options.d: To optimize source code for performance

questions.question: What does SQL stand for and what is its primary use?

options.a: Structured Query Language; used for managing databases
options.b: Sequential Query Language; used for web development
options.c: Simple Query Language; used for network protocols
options.d: Structured Question Language; used for data analysis
